member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.AllowNullAttribute
member.summary: A non-nullable parameter, field, or property may be null.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DisallowNullAttribute
member.summary: A nullable parameter, field, or property should never be null.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullAttribute
member.summary: A non-nullable parameter, field, property, or return value may be null.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullAttribute
member.summary: A nullable parameter, field, property, or return value will never be null.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MaybeNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: A non-nullable argument may be null when the method returns the specified boolean value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: A nullable argument won't be null when the method returns the specified boolean value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.NotNullIfNotNullAttribute
member.summary: A return value, property, or argument isn't null if the argument for the specified parameter isn't null.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnAttribute
member.summary: A method or property never returns. In other words, it always throws an exception.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.DoesNotReturnIfAttribute
member.summary: This method or property never returns if the associated boolean parameter has the specified value.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullAttribute
member.summary: The listed member won't be null when the method returns.

member.name: T:System.Diagnostics.CodeAnalysis.MemberNotNullWhenAttribute
member.summary: The listed member won't be null when the method returns the specified boolean value.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.Jwk.Base64Url

member.summary: Encodes the specified byte array.

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.Jwk.Base64Url.Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Decodes the specified string.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes
member.summary: Defines common JWT claim types.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Subject
member.summary: Unique Identifier for the End-User at the Issuer.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Name
member.summary: End-User's full name in displayable form including all name parts, possibly including titles and suffixes, ordered according to the End-User's locale and preferences.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.GivenName
member.summary: Given name(s) or first name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple given names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.FamilyName
member.summary: Surname(s) or last name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple family names or no family name; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.MiddleName
member.summary: Middle name(s) of the End-User. Note that in some cultures, people can have multiple middle names; all can be present, with the names being separated by space characters. Also note that in some cultures, middle names are not used.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.NickName
member.summary: Casual name of the End-User that may or may not be the same as the given_name. For instance, a nickname value of Mike might be returned alongside a given_name value of Michael.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.PreferredUserName
member.summary: Shorthand name by which the End-User wishes to be referred to at the RP, such as janedoe or j.doe. This value MAY be any valid JSON string including special characters such as @, /, or whitespace. The relying party MUST NOT rely upon this value being unique.
member.remarks: The RP MUST NOT rely upon this value being unique, as discussed in http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-basic-1_0-32.html#ClaimStability.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Profile
member.summary: URL of the End-User's profile page. The contents of this Web page SHOULD be about the End-User.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Picture
member.summary: URL of the End-User's profile picture. This URL MUST refer to an image file (for example, a PNG, JPEG, or GIF image file), rather than to a Web page containing an image.
member.remarks: Note that this URL SHOULD specifically reference a profile photo of the End-User suitable for displaying when describing the End-User, rather than an arbitrary photo taken by the End-User.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.WebSite
member.summary: URL of the End-User's Web page or blog. This Web page SHOULD contain information published by the End-User or an organization that the End-User is affiliated with.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Email
member.summary: End-User's preferred e-mail address. Its value MUST conform to the RFC 5322 [RFC5322] addr-spec syntax. The relying party MUST NOT rely upon this value being unique.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.EmailVerified
member.summary: "true" if the End-User's e-mail address has been verified; otherwise "false".
member.remarks: When this Claim Value is "true", this means that the OP took affirmative steps to ensure that this e-mail address was controlled by the End-User at the time the verification was performed. The means by which an e-mail address is verified is context-specific, and dependent upon the trust framework or contractual agreements within which the parties are operating.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Gender
member.summary: End-User's gender. Values defined by this specification are "female" and "male". Other values MAY be used when neither of the defined values are applicable.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.BirthDate
member.summary: End-User's birthday, represented as an ISO 8601:2004 [ISO8601‑2004] YYYY-MM-DD format. The year MAY be 0000, indicating that it is omitted. To represent only the year, YYYY format is allowed. Note that depending on the underlying platform's date related function, providing just year can result in varying month and day, so the implementers need to take this factor into account to correctly process the dates.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.ZoneInfo
member.summary: String from the time zone database (http://www.twinsun.com/tz/tz-link.htm) representing the End-User's time zone. For example, Europe/Paris or America/Los_Angeles.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Locale
member.summary: End-User's locale, represented as a BCP47 [RFC5646] language tag. This is typically an ISO 639-1 Alpha-2 [ISO639‑1] language code in lowercase and an ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 [ISO3166‑1] country code in uppercase, separated by a dash. For example, en-US or fr-CA. As a compatibility note, some implementations have used an underscore as the separator rather than a dash, for example, en_US; Relying Parties MAY choose to accept this locale syntax as well.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.PhoneNumber
member.summary: End-User's preferred telephone number. E.164 (https://www.itu.int/rec/T-REC-E.164/e) is RECOMMENDED as the format of this Claim, for example, +1 (425) 555-1212 or +56 (2) 687 2400. If the phone number contains an extension, it is RECOMMENDED that the extension be represented using the RFC 3966 [RFC3966] extension syntax, for example, +1 (604) 555-1234;ext=5678.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.PhoneNumberVerified
member.summary: True if the End-User's phone number has been verified; otherwise false. When this Claim Value is true, this means that the OP took affirmative steps to ensure that this phone number was controlled by the End-User at the time the verification was performed.
member.remarks: The means by which a phone number is verified is context-specific, and dependent upon the trust framework or contractual agreements within which the parties are operating. When true, the phone_number Claim MUST be in E.164 format and any extensions MUST be represented in RFC 3966 format.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Address
member.summary: End-User's preferred postal address. The value of the address member is a JSON structure containing some or all of the members defined in http://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-basic-1_0-32.html#AddressClaim.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Audience
member.summary: Audience(s) that this ID Token is intended for. It MUST contain the OAuth 2.0 client_id of the Relying Party as an audience value. It MAY also contain identifiers for other audiences. In the general case, the aud value is an array of case sensitive strings. In the common special case when there is one audience, the aud value MAY be a single case sensitive string.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Issuer
member.summary: Issuer Identifier for the Issuer of the response. The iss value is a case sensitive URL using the https scheme that contains scheme, host, and optionally, port number and path components and no query or fragment components.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.NotBefore
member.summary: The time before which the JWT MUST NOT be accepted for processing, specified as the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Expiration
member.summary: The exp (expiration time) claim identifies the expiration time on or after which the token MUST NOT be accepted for processing, specified as the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.UpdatedAt
member.summary: Time the End-User's information was last updated. Its value is a JSON number representing the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z as measured in UTC until the date/time.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.IssuedAt
member.summary: The iat (issued at) claim identifies the time at which the JWT was issued, , specified as the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.AuthenticationMethod
member.summary: Authentication Methods References. JSON array of strings that are identifiers for authentication methods used in the authentication.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.SessionId
member.summary: Session identifier. This represents a Session of an OP at an RP to a User Agent or device for a logged-in End-User. Its contents are unique to the OP and opaque to the RP.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.AuthenticationContextClassReference
member.summary: Authentication Context Class Reference. String specifying an Authentication Context Class Reference value that identifies the Authentication Context Class that the authentication performed satisfied. The value "0" indicates the End-User authentication did not meet the requirements of ISO/IEC 29115 level 1. Authentication using a long-lived browser cookie, for instance, is one example where the use of "level 0" is appropriate. Authentications with level 0 SHOULD NOT be used to authorize access to any resource of any monetary value. (This corresponds to the OpenID 2.0 PAPE nist_auth_level 0.) An absolute URI or an RFC 6711 registered name SHOULD be used as the acr value; registered names MUST NOT be used with a different meaning than that which is registered. Parties using this claim will need to agree upon the meanings of the values used, which may be context-specific. The acr value is a case sensitive string.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.AuthenticationTime
member.summary: Time when the End-User authentication occurred. Its value is a JSON number representing the number of seconds from 1970-01-01T0:0:0Z as measured in UTC until the date/time. When a max_age request is made or when auth_time is requested as an Essential Claim, then this Claim is REQUIRED; otherwise, its inclusion is OPTIONAL.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.AuthorizedParty
member.summary: The party to which the ID Token was issued. If present, it MUST contain the OAuth 2.0 Client ID of this party. This Claim is only needed when the ID Token has a single audience value and that audience is different than the authorized party. It MAY be included even when the authorized party is the same as the sole audience. The azp value is a case sensitive string containing a StringOrURI value.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.AccessTokenHash
member.summary: Access Token hash value. Its value is the base64url encoding of the left-most half of the hash of the octets of the ASCII representation of the access_token value, where the hash algorithm used is the hash algorithm used in the alg Header Parameter of the ID Token's JOSE Header. For instance, if the alg is RS256, hash the access_token value with SHA-256, then take the left-most 128 bits and base64url encode them. The at_hash value is a case sensitive string.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.AuthorizationCodeHash
member.summary: Code hash value. Its value is the base64url encoding of the left-most half of the hash of the octets of the ASCII representation of the code value, where the hash algorithm used is the hash algorithm used in the alg Header Parameter of the ID Token's JOSE Header. For instance, if the alg is HS512, hash the code value with SHA-512, then take the left-most 256 bits and base64url encode them. The c_hash value is a case sensitive string.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Nonce
member.summary: String value used to associate a Client session with an ID Token, and to mitigate replay attacks. The value is passed through unmodified from the Authentication Request to the ID Token. If present in the ID Token, Clients MUST verify that the nonce Claim Value is equal to the value of the nonce parameter sent in the Authentication Request. If present in the Authentication Request, Authorization Servers MUST include a nonce Claim in the ID Token with the Claim Value being the nonce value sent in the Authentication Request. Authorization Servers SHOULD perform no other processing on nonce values used. The nonce value is a case sensitive string.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.JwtId
member.summary: JWT ID. A unique identifier for the token, which can be used to prevent reuse of the token. These tokens MUST only be used once, unless conditions for reuse were negotiated between the parties; any such negotiation is beyond the scope of this specification.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Events
member.summary: Defines a set of event statements that each may add additional claims to fully describe a single logical event that has occurred.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.ClientId
member.summary: OAuth 2.0 Client Identifier valid at the Authorization Server.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Scope
member.summary: OpenID Connect requests MUST contain the "openid" scope value. If the openid scope value is not present, the behavior is entirely unspecified. Other scope values MAY be present. Scope values used that are not understood by an implementation SHOULD be ignored.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Id
member.summary: An identifier.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.IdentityProvider
member.summary: The identity provider.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Role
member.summary: The role.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.ReferenceTokenId
member.summary: The reference token identifier.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtClaimTypes.Confirmation
member.summary: The confirmation.

member.summary: Defines custom JWT claim types.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtCustomClaimTypes.Name
member.summary: The user name.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtCustomClaimTypes.DisplayName
member.summary: The user display name.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtCustomClaimTypes.Culture
member.summary: The user culture.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtCustomClaimTypes.Picture
member.summary: The user picture.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtCustomClaimTypes.SecurityStamp
member.summary: The user security stamp.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.JwtCustomClaimTypes.EmailVerified
member.summary: A value indicating whether the email is verified.

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.Jwt.JwtSecurityToken
member.summary: Describes a JWT security token.
member.remarks: The implementation is incomplete, so it only allows to access a small set of the token properties.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.Jwt.JwtSecurityToken.Raw
member.summary: Gets the raw JWT token.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.Jwt.JwtSecurityToken.ExpiresOn
member.summary: Gets the moment (UTC) when the token expires.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.Jwt.JwtSecurityToken.ClientId
member.summary: Gets the client identifier.

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.Jwt.JwtSecurityToken.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.Jwt.JwtSecurityToken.IsExpiredOrExpiresIn(System.TimeSpan)
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the token is expired or expires in less than .
member.returns: A value indicating whether the token is expired or expires in less than .

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.DeviceAuthorization.Response.DeviceCode

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.DeviceAuthorization.Response.UserCode
member.summary: The end-user code.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.DeviceAuthorization.Response.VerificationUri
member.summary: The verification URI.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.DeviceAuthorization.Response.VerificationUriComplete
member.summary: The verification URI (including the user code).

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.DeviceAuthorization.Response.ExpiresIn
member.summary: The lifetime in seconds of the "device_code" and "user_code".

member.name: T:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.Token.Error
member.summary: Defines constants that define errors.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.Token.Error.InvalidRequest
member.summary: The request is missing a required parameter, includes an invalid parameter value, includes a parameter more than once, or is otherwise malformed.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.Token.Error.InvalidClient
member.summary: Client authentication failed (e.g., unknown client, no client authentication included, or unsupported authentication method).

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.Token.Error.InvalidGrant
member.summary: The provided authorization grant (e.g., authorization code, resource owner credentials) or refresh token is invalid, expired, revoked, does not match the redirection URI used in the authorization request, or was issued to another client.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.Token.Error.UnauthorizedClient
member.summary: The client is not authorized to request an access token using this method.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.Token.Error.UnsupportedGrantType
member.summary: The authorization grant type is not supported by the authorization server.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.Token.Error.UnsupportedResponseType
member.summary: The authorization server does not support obtaining an authorization code using this method.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.Token.Error.InvalidScope
member.summary: The requested scope is invalid, unknown, or malformed.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.Token.Error.AuthorizationPending
member.summary: The authorization request is still pending as the end user hasn't yet completed the user-interaction steps.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.Token.Error.AccessDenied
member.summary: The resource owner or authorization server denied the request.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.Token.Error.SlowDown
member.summary: A variant of "authorization_pending", the authorization request is still pending and polling should continue, but the interval MUST be increased by 5 seconds for this and all subsequent requests.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.Token.Error.ExpiredToken
member.summary: The "device_code" has expired, and the device authorization session has concluded. The client MAY commence a new device authorization request but SHOULD wait for user interaction before restarting to avoid unnecessary polling.

member.name: F:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.OidcConstants.Token.Error.InvalidTarget
member.summary: The requested resource is invalid, missing, unknown, or malformed.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.Properties.Resources.RES_Exception_InvalidBase64URL
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to Invalid Base64 URL..

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.Properties.Resources.RES_Exception_InvalidJwtToken
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The provided token does not seem to be a valid JWT token..

member.name: P:Primavera.Hydrogen.IdentityModel.Properties.Resources.RES_Exception_ParsingJwtToken
member.summary: Looks up a localized string similar to The provided token does not seem to be a valid JWT token. Property '{0}' does not exist..
